name: vscode-animations
description: Clean and customizable animations for VSCode

animations.Enabled.description: Whether or not to enable animations

animations.Install-Method.markdownDescription: The extension to use for injecting the animations. **NOTE:** This is a **very important** setting, if you don't know what this means, leave it as `Custom CSS and JS`

animations.Auto-Install.markdownDescription: Whether or not to automatically install the animations with the [Custom CSS and JS extension](https://github.com/be5invis/vscode-custom-css), default: `true`. **IMPORTANT:** If set to `false`, you will need to manually install the animations by using the command `Animations: Get Script Path` to copy the path into your favorite custom injection extension (ex: [apc-extension](https://github.com/drcika/apc-extension)). **ONLY do this if you understand what this means.**

animations.Smooth-Mode.markdownDescription: Make everything **SMOOTH**! Whether or not to use smooth animations on all windows (sidebars, split screens, etc.)

animations.Custom-CSS.description: Whether or not to use the custom CSS file

animations.Focus-Dimming-Amount.markdownDescription: The amount to dim parts of vscode when a new window gains focus, default: `50%`

animations.Focus-Dimming-Mode.markdownDescription: The mode to use for focus dimming, `None` disables dimming entirely, `Window` will dim the entire window, `Everything But Editor`, `Everything But Terminal`, and `Everything But Editor and Terminal` will dim everything but the editor, terminal, or both based on option, default: `Full Window`

animations.Command-Palette.description: The animation to use for the command palette

animations.Tabs.description: The animation to use for tabs

animations.Active.description: The animation to use for the active list item

animations.Scrolling.description: The animation to use for when new list items appear when scrolling

animations.Default-Duration.markdownDescription: The default duration of all the animations in milliseconds, default: `300`, **NOTE:** This is the default duration for all animations, you can change the duration of each animation individually in the `Durations` section

animations.Durations.description: The durations of the animations in milliseconds

Command-Palette.markdownDescription: The duration of the animation for the command palette in milliseconds, default: `300`

Tabs.markdownDescription: The duration of the animation for tabs in milliseconds, default: `200`

Active.markdownDescription: The duration of the animation for files in milliseconds, default: `200`

Scrolling.markdownDescription: The duration of the animation for when new list items appear when scrolling in milliseconds, default: `200`

Smooth-Mode.markdownDescription: The duration of the animation for when new list items appear when scrolling in milliseconds, default: `200`

Focus-Dimming.markdownDescription: The duration of the animation for when a new window gains focus in milliseconds, default: `200`

animations.CursorAnimation.description: Whether or not to enable the cursor animation

Color.description: The color of the cursor animation

CursorStyle.markdownDescription: The type of cursor to use, either `line` or `block`

TrailLength.markdownDescription: The length of the cursor trail, should stay around `8`, higher might cause performance issues

scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
